channel.title: The Ringer Reality TV Podcast
channel.description: The Ringer Reality TV Podcast is the home for all things unscripted TV. Johnny Bananas recaps 'The Challenge,' Tyson Apostol recaps 'Survivor,' Rachel Lindsay recaps all the shows over at Bravo, and Ringer favorites cover all manner of streaming shows across the reality spectrum, from 'The Great British Bake Off' to 'The Circle' to 'Selling Sunset.'

item.title: We Interview Crystal Kung Minkoff! Plus ‘Salt Lake City’ Episode 6 and ‘Potomac’ Episode 4
item.description: To kick off this week’s ‘Morally Corrupt’ podcast, Rachel Lindsay and Jodi Walker are joined by Crystal Kung Minkoff of 'The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills’ who dishes all about the latest reunion and her memories of that infamous Aspen trip (00:52)! Then Rachel and Jodi break down Season 3, Episode 6 of ‘The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City’ (42:09). Finally, Rachel teams up with Callie Curry to discuss Season 7, Episode 4 of ‘The Real Housewives of Potomac’ (01:07:41). Host: Rachel Lindsay Guests: Crystal Kung Minkoff, Jodi Walker, and Callie Curry Producers: Devon Manze and Chelsea Stark-Jones Theme Song: Devon Renaldo Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: You’re Doing Amazing Sweetie: A Kardashian Recap Show | It Was All A Stream
item.description: After a very Kardashian Halloween, Amelia Wedemeyer and Zack Peter discuss which sister wore the best costume (5:30), before getting into Episode 7 of ‘The Kardashians.’ The pair break down Kim’s Met Gala journey (17:50), her attempt to fit into the iconic Marilyn Monroe dress, and Kourtney’s prenuptial trip to Milan with Travis (40:00). Hosts: Amelia Wedemeyer and Zack Peter Producer: Devon Renaldo Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘Survivor’ Season 43, Episode 7
item.description:
Tyson and Riley are joined by former ‘Survivor’ winner Ethan Zohn to discuss Episode 7 of Season 43. They talk about the passive playmaking from this year’s group, the lack of secret keeping, gut vs. strategy on ‘Survivor,’ and this week’s shocking blindside at Tribal Council.
Hosts: Tyson Apostol and Riley McAtee Guest: Ethan Zohn Producer: Kai Grady Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘The Challenge: Ride or Dies’ Episodes 3 and 4 With Jordan | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: Johnny sits down with decorated veteran of ‘The Challenge’ and new ‘Ride or Dies’ arrival Jordan Wiseley to go through the love, hookups, drama, and backstabbing in the third and fourth episodes. They dive into what it felt like for Jordan and Tori to meet in the game after not seeing each other for years, and why Jordan felt it was the right time to mend the fence. Host: Johnny Bananas Guest: Jordan Wiseley Producer: Sasha Ashall Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.description: This week, Amelia Wedemeyer and Zack Peter recap the fifth episode of 'The Kardashians.' Zack dives straight into the headline of the week: Did Kris Jenner really sleep with Drake? (3:50) Later on, the duo chat about Kris wanting to get cremated and placed into a necklace (14:00), then Amelia gives a hot take on Kendall (27:17), plus much more. item.title: ‘Survivor’ Season 43, Episode 5
item.description:
Tyson and Riley are joined by former ‘Survivor’ winner Michele Fitzgerald to talk through this season’s fifth episode. They discuss Ryan’s surprising decision to throw the challenge, explain how Geo’s misplaced confidence led to his downfall, and compliment the excellent behind-the-scenes work from the ‘Survivor’ production team.
Hosts: Tyson Apostol and Riley McAtee Guest: Michele Fitzgerald Producers: Jessie Lopez and Kai Grady Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.description: The 'Morally Corrupt' crew reports to you live from their hotel rooms on day 2 of BravoCon 2022! item.title: 'The Great British Bake Off' Season 13, Episode 1: "Cake Week"| Everything Is Cake
item.description: Amelia and Kate get together to celebrate the triumphant return of not only 'The Great British Bake Off,' but also a new season of 'Everything Is Cake'! They start their conversation by discussing the brand-new contestants and their backstories, particularly Mark, Syabira, Sandro, Dawn, and the mysterious "Mr. Frogington" (2:35). Next they go over this week's challenges, giving special kudos to Sandro and Abdul's mini sandwich plant bakes for the technical challenge and then salivating over the red velvet cake that won Syabira the signature portion (10:27). They then shift their focus to the showstoppers and ponder what type of cake they would make into a 3D version of their childhood home (21:39). After the break they hand out their weekly awards for soggiest bottom, most British moment, the best Brit fit, and much more (28:21). Hosts: Kate Halliwell and Amelia Wedemeyer Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Production Assistance: Chris Sutton Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Evel Dick's Reality Villain Redemption | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: 'Big Brother' legend Evel Dick Donato joins Johnny to talk about how he went down in history as one of the greatest 'Big Brother' villains of all time on Season 8. They discuss how he was blindsided by production when they cast both him and his daughter on the same season, his hate/hate relationship with Jen Johnson, how social media and the proliferation of reality television has altered the medium, and quite a lot more! item.title: Spencer Pratt’s Reality Villain Redemption Part 2 | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: Johnny continues his conversation with one of the greatest reality television villains of all time: Spencer Pratt. In this episode, Spencer talks about his forays into reality television after ‘The Hills,’ including his stint on ‘I’m A Celebrity Get Me Out of Here’ and ‘Celebrity Big Brother UK.’ Then he tells Johnny what he wishes he could change about how he approached his early fame and what advice he would give his former self. item.title: Revisiting Johnny Bananas’s Seventh ‘Challenge’ Win With Bill Simmons | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: This week we’re revisiting Johnny’s July 2020 interview with Bill Simmons on ‘The Bill Simmons Podcast’ about his seventh ‘Challenge’ win on ‘Total Madness,’ which broke his six-season finals drought and the curse that Jemmye put on him after he stole Sarah’s half of their winnings on ‘Rivals 3.’ Nearly two years later, their conversation about how to save ‘The Challenge’ is as relevant as ever. You can also listen to Johnny discussing his iconic moment from the 'Rivals 3' finale with Bill Simmons on 'The Bill Simmons Podcast.' Hosts: Bill Simmons and Johnny Bananas Producers: Craig Horlbeck and Sasha Ashall Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 'Beverly Hills' Episode 2, 'Atlanta' Episode 3, and Saying Goodbye to 'New Jersey' and 'Summer House' | Morally Corrupt
item.description: Welcome to 'Morally Corrupt,' where Rachel Lindsay is joined every week by your favorite Ringer podcasters to talk everything and anything Bravo. This week, Rachel and Callie start the show with a chat about recent divorce news in Bravo-land (1:08) before Rachel gives a quick recap of this week’s lackluster episode of 'The Real Housewives of Atlanta' (13:57). Then Rachel is joined by Jodi and Amelia to talk about the most recent episode of 'The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills' (17:15). Later, Rachel and Callie return to chat about the conclusion of 'The Real Housewives of New Jersey' reunion (44:30) and finally, Jodi and Chelsea bookend this season of 'Summer House' with a discussion about its final reunion episode (62:01). Later, Rachel and Callie return to chat about the conclusion of 'The Real Housewives of New Jersey' reunion (44:30) and finally, Jodi and Chelsea bookend this season of 'Summer House' with a discussion about its final reunion episode (62:01).

Host: Rachel Lindsay

item.title: Jordan Wiseley and Johnny Bananas on Their Humanitarian Efforts in Ukraine | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: Johnny recounts his experiences traveling through Poland and Ukraine and the humanitarian work he did there in collaboration with the organization Humanosh. He speaks with the people who reached out to him to come over and help, Jen Rubio and Scott Mitchell, about how they got involved and what they’ve seen of the crisis at the border. He also speaks with Polish doctor Kate Pikulska, who has worked on several humanitarian efforts with Humanosh, in Lviv. Then he welcomes Jordan Wiseley to the podcast to talk about how his impulsive trip to Poland to help out turned into becoming the UN-recognized humanitarian organization Foreign United Peoples NGO. Here’s where you can donate to Humanosh to help them deliver life-saving shelter and supplies to refugees. Here’s where you can donate to Jordan Wiseley’s NGO to deliver supplies to Ukraine and transport refugees to Poland. Host: Johnny Bananas Guests, Jordan Wiseley, Jen, Scott, Kate Pikulska Producer: Sasha Ashall Additional Production: Juliet Litman and Chelsea Stark-Jones Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: Tony Raines on Coming Into His Own on ‘The Challenge’ and His Complicated Relationship With Johnny Bananas | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: After forming one of the most complex and fascinating relationships on ‘The Challenge,’ Johnny Bananas and Tony Raines hash out all the details of their friendship and foeship. They start with Tony’s turbulent start in reality television on ‘Real World: Skeletons’ and the fights and the injuries on his first 'Challenge' season, ‘Battle of the Bloodlines.’ Then they go through Tony’s finest and lowest moments on the show, from ‘Rivals 3’ to ‘Invasion of the Champions,’ and all the defining moments of their relationship throughout ‘Dirty 30,’ ‘Vendettas,’ and ‘Final Reckoning,’ including what really happened behind the scenes during the fateful Milk and Cookies Elimination. Host: Johnny Bananas Guest: Tony Raines Producer: Sasha Ashall Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘The Challenge’ Hall of Fame: Emily Schromm | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: Johnny is joined this week by Emily Schromm, who in her three-season 'Challenge' career went to three finals and won one. Her size, strength, and athleticism made her a dominant player in her seasons and led her to an unheard of 100 percent success rate in eliminations, going 5-0. She stops by to talk about how she got discovered for the ‘Real World,’ some of her favorite memories from ‘The Challenge,’ and what she’s been up to since. Host: Johnny Bananas Guest: Emily Schromm Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘The Challenge: Spies, Lies, and Allies’ Episode 13 With Cory | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: Johnny welcomes leader of the opposition, Cory, to the podcast to talk about his experiences on ‘The Challenge’ this season and their rivalry over the years (0:30). They discuss Cory’s masterful techniques in stoking the flames between Josh and Fessy (6:45) and his positioning in the house between the vets and the rookies (17:45). Then they dig into Episode 13, including CT’s ridiculous speech in nominations (45:00), Cory’s scorched-earth tactics in the aftermath of nominations (54:55), and his grueling elimination challenge against Logan (57:42). Host: Johnny Bananas Guest: Cory Wharton Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Additional Production: Juliet Litman Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 'The Great British Bake Off' Season 9, Episode 6: "Pastry Week" | Everything Is Cake
item.description: Kate and Amelia return to discuss what is often the most difficult week for the bakers: pastry week. They talk about their favorite pastry creations of yore (0:25) before getting into a trendy chouxnut signature challenge (7:40), a just-plain-rude baklava technical challenge (12:40), and the lightly esoteric pâté en croûte showstopper challenge (16:00). Then they discuss the winner and loser of the episode and hand out their awards for soggiest bottom, best sound bites, most absurdly British moment, and more (26:30). Hosts: Kate Halliwell and Amelia Wedemeyer Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘The Challenge: Spies, Lies, and Allies’ Episode 12 (500th Episode!) With Leroy | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: Johnny celebrates the 500th episode of ‘The Challenge’ with his longtime friend and accomplice, Leroy. They discuss CT’s manipulative strategies throughout his long tenure on the show and in this season with Emy (0:25) and why Josh is one of their favorite contestants right now (30:35). Then they take a walk down memory lane and talk about their friendship on the show and their favorite stories from their time together on ‘The Challenge’ (32:30). Host: Johnny Bananas Guest: Leroy Garrett Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Additional Production: Juliet Litman Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 'The Great British Bake Off' Season 9, Episode 5: "German Week" | Everything Is Cake
item.description: Oh, the Germanity! Amelia and Sasha hold down the fort as Kate galavants across some foreign land by breaking down Episode 5 of Season 9 of 'The Great British Bake Off.' First, Amelia catches us all up on her thoughts about Chigs's big week (0:30). Then we dive into the delights of "German Week," which include a double batch German cookie signature challenge (6:00), a classically obscure Prinzregententorte technical challenge (13:45), and a baffling tiered yeasted cake showstopper challenge (21:30). Finally, we discuss this week's winner and loser and give out our awards for Soggiest Bottom, Best Brit Fit, Most Absurdly British Moment, and more (32:50). Host: Amelia Wedemeyer Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘The Challenge: Spies, Lies, and Allies’ Episode 11 With Ed | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: Rookie Ed Eason joins Johnny Bananas to talk about Episode 11 of ‘Spies, Lies, and Allies.’ First Ed tells Johnny how he got his start in reality on ‘The Circle’ (0:30) and how he approached the challenge of coming on ‘The Challenge’ late as an alternate (19:06). Then they dive into Episode 11. They discuss the game shifting from pairs to teams (39:36), the season’s first heights over water challenge (52:25), Ed putting a target on his back for nominations (59:23), and the intense pole wrestling elimination between him and Kyle (1:22:04). Host: Johnny Bananas Guest: Ed Eason Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Additional Production: Juliet Litman Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘The Great British Bake Off’ Season 9, Episode 4: “Dessert Week” | Everything Is Cake
item.description: Kate is joined by genuine British person Lucy Ford to discuss “Dessert Week” and the intricacies of the definition of “pudding” (0:30). We discuss a light and airy pavlova signature challenge (7:25), a tricky sticky technical challenge (24:50), and a showstopper challenge filled with set custard (34:10). Then we do a special ‘Bake Off’ grannies ranking in honor of Maggie (42:30) and we hand out our awards for soggiest bottom, most absurdly British moment, and more (48:05). Host: Kate Halliwell Guest: Lucy Ford Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘The Challenge: Spies, Lies, and Allies’ Episode 10 With Ashley | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: The legend Ashley “Meltdown” Mitchell joins Bananas to dish the dirt on Episode 10 of ‘Spies, Lies, and Allies.’ First they get down into the details of her fling with Nelson, the definition of “polidicking,” and her real issue with Burna (0:40). Then they get into the more recent drama between her and Cory over the money she stole from Hunter after winning ‘Final Reckoning’ (31:00). Then they talk about the twist at the end of Episode 8 (38:00), the multi-level challenge and new groups formed at the end (45:30), and the night out at the club (57:30). Finally, they talk about a very vocal and eventful nomination (1:06:22) and elimination challenge (1:11:05). Host: Johnny Bananas Guest: Ashley Mitchell Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Additional Production: Juliet Litman Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.description: It’s that make-or-break moment for the bakers in the bubble: Bread Week. We discuss our favorite bread bakes from seasons past (0:30) before getting into all the details of a very on-trend focaccia signature challenge (4:40), a dastardly ciabatta technical challenge (13:30), and a very cute milk bread showstopper challenge (18:45). Then we hand out our awards for the soggiest bottom, best Matt moment, best sound bites, and more (35:50). item.title: ‘The Challenge: Spies, Lies, and Allies’ Episode 9 With Derrick K. | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: This week Johnny welcomes his two-time co-winner Derrick Kosinski to the show to talk about the conflicts and blunders in Episode 9. First, they dig into the implosion of the veteran alliance with Cory taking the heat from other vets for rallying the rookies together, as well as the many, many strategic mistakes Cory made in protecting his new alliance (0:35). They get into the best daily challenge so far this season, in which the contestants had to retrieve balls from a mud pit and, shockingly, there were no bombs to diffuse (32:30). Then they discuss all the conversations that happened in the house after the daily challenge (38:35), the ugly fight between Ashley and Cory in nominations and the history behind that conflict (46:04), the tricky elimination challenge (54:30), and the surprise twist at the end (1:00:40). Host: Johnny Bananas Guest: Derrick Kosinski Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Additional Production: Juliet Litman Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘The Great British Bake Off’ Season 9, Episode 2: “Biscuit Week” | Everything Is Cake
item.description: Kate and Amelia discuss “Biscuit Week” in all its crispy, snappy, gingerbread-y glory. We talk about successes and failures from the tricky brandysnap signature challenge (0:40), a distinctive lack of definition from the deceptively difficult jammy-cookie sandwich technical challenge (12:30), and incredible interactive biscuit toys from the showstopper challenge (17:30). Finally we hand out our awards for the soggiest bottom, the most absurdly British moment, best soundbites, and many more (29:35). Hosts: Kate Halliwell and Amelia Wedemeyer Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

Finally we hand out our awards for the soggiest bottom, the most absurdly British moment, best soundbites, and many more (29:35).

Hosts: Kate Halliwell and Amelia Wedemeyer

Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall

item.title: ‘The Challenge: Spies, Lies, and Allies’ Episode 8 With Hughie | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: This week, Johnny welcomes everyone’s favorite rookie, Hughie Maughan, to the podcast to talk about all the behind-the-scenes details, dramas, and tidbits. First, Hughie tells Johnny how he got his start in reality television on ‘Big Brother’ (0:40) and why he chose Ashley to be his partner at the beginning of ‘The Challenge’ (16:30). Then they get into all the juicy details of the veteran alliance (22:50), Hughie’s mid-elimination fight with Corey (43:50), the drama between Emy and Burna (54:55), the frustrating challenge that Hughie and Burna almost won (1:09:00), and how his ass got in the way of winning the elimination (1:22:00). item.title: ‘The Great British Bake Off’ Season 9, Episode 1: “Cake Week” | Everything Is Cake
item.description: Welcome to the tent, bakers! The Ringer’s Kate Halliwell and Amelia Wedemeyer will be here on ‘The Ringer Reality TV Podcast’ every Friday to recap the new season of ‘The Great British Bake Off.’ In this episode, covering “Cake Week,” we first talk about how we got into the show and why we love it so much (0:30). Then we get to the nitty-gritty, digging into a dastardly signature challenge, in which the bakers had to make mini Swiss rolls (14:25), a confusing technical challenge based on Prue’s recipe for malt loaf (20:00), and a gravity-defying showstopper challenge (23:05). Finally, we hand out our awards for the soggiest bottom, the most absurdly British moment, the best Brit fit, and much more (32:55). Hosts: Kate Halliwell and Amelia Wedemeyer Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘The Challenge: Spies, Lies, and Allies’ Episode 7 With Amber B. | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: This week, Johnny is joined by Amber B. to discuss an explosive Episode 7 of ‘The Challenge: Spies, Lies, and Allies.’ First they discuss how Amber got her start on reality television on ‘Big Brother’ (0:30), and then they get into her leftover beef with Fessy from last season of ‘The Challenge’—which she won—and how that affected the ‘Big Brother’ alliance this season (16:20). After that, it's all drama. Johnny and Amber B. discuss what her mindset was coming into the game as an alternate, whether she would be in an alliance with the 'Big Brother' crew, and the nitty gritty details of the alliance (36:15). Then they talk about Fessy throwing Amber B. into the elimination in Episode 4 (54:30) and the wild fight over some pizza that ends with disastrous consequences (1:02:30). Hosts: Johnny Bananas Guest: Amber Borzotra Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Additional Production: Juliet Litman Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City’ is Back and ‘The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills’ Pull Off the Sit-down Dinner. Plus: Updates on ‘The Challenge,’ ‘Big Brother,’ and More! | Reality Top 5
item.description:
Juliet and Callie discuss the season premiere of ‘The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City’ (0:42), before then talking through all the drama from ‘The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills,’ including Dorit’s dress party, PK’s glow-up, and their favorite Kathy Hilton moment of the week (17:30). Then, they catch up with ‘The Challenge’ and highlight Kaycee and Nany’s date as a huge step in the right direction for the show (38:36). Finally, they touch on all they’ve been watching: ‘Married at First Sight,’ ‘The D’Amelio Show,’ ‘Big Brother,’ ‘The Circle,’ and ‘LuLaRich’ (44:46).
Hosts: Juliet Litman and Callie Curry
Associate Producer: Erika Cervantes Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘The Challenge: Spies, Lies, and Allies’ Episode 5 With Kyle Christie | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: Icon of ‘The Challenge,’ and ‘Geordie Shore’ and ‘Spies, Lies, and Allies’ cast member Kyle Christie joins Bananas this week to discuss Episode 5. Bananas asks Kyle what it was like being a vet in the first few weeks when they were picking rookies off like flies and they discuss what strategies the rookies should’ve used against the vets (13:10). They get into last week’s explosive elimination and the new fracture in the Big Brother alliance (22:00) and what it’s actually like to be around Emmanuel, Gabo, and Hughie (26:00). Then they talk about CT and Berna winning the daily challenge and not having to pay the consequences of properly nominating anyone because of the strange phenomenon of rookies nominating themselves to go into elimination (37:25). Finally, they talk about the grueling elimination challenge between Gabo and Logan (54:55). Host: Johnny Bananas Guest: Kyle Christie Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Additional Production: Juliet Litman and Lani Renaldo Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘Below Deck Mediterranean,’ ‘Real Housewives,’ ‘The Challenge,’ ‘Married at First Sight,’ and ‘Sweet Life’ | Reality Top Five
item.description: 1. Juliet and Callie break down this week’s drama on ‘Real Housewives of Beverly Hills’ at the Rinna makeup event (0:30). 2. Callie catches Juliet up on the current season of ‘Real Housewives of Potomac,’ including Wendy’s off screen transformation and rumors of her husband’s infidelity (22:00). 3. Juliet shares her love for the warm blanket that is ‘Below Deck Mediterranean,’ which has recently gained a new cast member, Delaney (37:50). 4. They talk about how Tommy ended up naked during the cliff jump challenge on ‘The Challenge’ and how much they miss the older vets like CT and Nany who aren’t getting a ton of screen time this season (45:20). 5. Last up, they do a speed round of shows that they’ve started watching or been told they need to watch, including ‘Sweet Life,’ ‘Married at First Sight,’ ‘Ultimate Surfer’ and ‘100 Foot Wave,’ and ‘Family or Fiancé' (52:50). Hosts: Juliet Litman and Callie Curry Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: ‘The Challenge: Spies, Lies, and Allies’ Episode 3 With Wes Bergmann | Death, Taxes, and Bananas
item.description: The alliance is strong, folks. ‘The Challenge’ icon Wes Bergmann joins Johnny Bananas to talk about Episode 3 of ‘Spies, Lies, and Allies.’ After catching up a bit, they dive into the pros and cons of the vets vs. rookies strategy that’s playing out (0:45) and Tori’s strategy or lack thereof (40:50). Then they talk about the challenge itself, nominations (47:08), and the elimination challenge (1:02:12). Finally, Johnny and Wes get to tea time when they talk about all the gossip, relationships, and revenge so far this season including Kelz’s to-do list, Ashley and Nelson’s relationship, and Amanda and Tori’s beef (1:05:30). item.title: FBoy Island,’ ‘Love Island UK,’ ‘The Challenge,’ ‘Real Housewives of Beverly Hills,’ and ‘Sweet Life: Los Angeles’ | Reality Top 5
item.description: 1. Callie and Juliet debate the merits and pitfalls of the “F-boy”–“nice guy” dichotomy on ‘FBoy Island’ (0:30). 2. Juliet shares her impressions of ‘Love Island UK’ Season 7 after watching her first episodes ever (11:53). 3. Juliet and Callie discuss their favorite and least favorite vets on this season of ‘The Challenge’ and the vets vs. rookies dynamic (22:50). 4. It’s all about Erika on ‘Real Housewives of Beverly Hills.’ How could her lawyers let her go on the show? How could she not read the papers her husband had asked her to sign? We ponder those questions and more (36:27). 5. Juliet tells Callie about a new show on HBO Max from producer Issa Rae called ‘Sweet Life: Los Angeles,’ which is basically ‘Insecure’ in real life (53:30). Hosts: Juliet Litman and Callie Curry Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 'Love Island U.K.', 'Real Housewives', 'FBoy Island', 'Siesta Key', and 'Big Brother' | Reality Top Five
item.description: 1. Callie sells Juliet on her favorite reality show, 'Love Island U.K.', and explains the difference between the U.K. and U.S. series (0:45). 2. Callie and Juliet discuss the success of the 'Real Housewives of Potomac', the abject failure of 'New York', and the dramas of 'Beverly Hills' (16:00). 3. Juliet convinces Callie to binge 'FBoy Island' on HBO Max this weekend (35:35). 4. Callie explains the ins and outs of the Florida lifestyle as seen on 'Siesta Key' (45:00). 5. Callie discusses her second-favorite reality show 'Big Brother', which is now on Season 23 in the U.S. (54:50). Follow the ‘Ringer Reality TV Podcast’ on Spotify or subscribe wherever you get your podcasts. Also on this feed: Amelia Wedemeyer recaps 'Bachelor in Paradise' on Tuesday nights exclusively on Spotify, and Johnny Bananas recaps 'The Challenge' on Wednesdays. Hosts: Juliet Litman and Callie Curry Associate Producer: Sasha Ashall Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
